name: cotton candy dot slipover
notes:
**size**
xs (s, m, l, xl, 2xl, 3xl, 4xl, 5xl)

**measurements**
to fit bust: 28”-30” (32”-34”, 36”-38”, 40”-42”, 44”-46”, 48”-50”, 52”-54”, 56”-58”, 60”-62”) / 71-76 cm (81-86 cm, 91.5-96.5 cm, 101.5-106.5 cm, 111.5-117 cm, 122-127 cm, 132-137 cm, 142-147 cm, 152-158 cm)
final bust: 34” (38”, 42”, 46”, 50”, 54”, 58”, 62”, 66”) / 86 cm (96 cm, 106 cm, 117 cm, 127 cm, 137 cm, 147.5 cm, 157.5 cm, 167.5 cm)
front/back panel width: 17” (19”, 21”, 23”, 25”, 27”, 29”, 31”, 33”) / 43 cm (48 cm, 53 cm, 58.5 cm, 63.5 cm, 68.5 cm, 73.5 cm, 78.5 cm, 83.5 cm)
front/back panel length: 20.5” (20.5”, 20.5”, 21.7”, 21.7”, 21.7”, 22.5”, 22.5”, 22.5”) / 52 cm (52 cm, 52 cm, 55 cm, 55 cm, 55 cm, 57 cm, 57 cm, 57 cm)

**materials**
7 (7, 8, 9, 10, 10, 11, 12, 13) skeins of garland color 11

crochet hook 5.00 mm / us h-8 (or size needed to obtain gauge)
yarn needle for weaving in ends and seam
scissors
tape measure for checking gauge and lengths throughout the pattern
stitch markers

**yarn quality**
garland, hobbii
70% cotton, 30% alpaca
50 g / 1.76 oz = 105 m / 114 yds

**gauge**
14 hdc x 11 rows = 10 cm x 10 cm / 4” x 4”
(important: measurements given by a blocked gauge swatch. i used the steam blocking method)

**pattern information**
meet the new addition to the cotton candy dot collection! this vest is perfect for layering between seasons, adding an extra touch of style to your outfits.

here are some characteristics of the pattern:
- intermediate crochet pattern, written in us terms.
- photos of main steps included.
- the vest is worked bottom up in two panels (one back panel and one front panel). the finishing of collar and armholes are crocheted onto the body once it’s sewn.
- the sample in the picture is a size s.
